00080 MeshImpl::MeshImpl() 
00081     : numCoords(0),
00082       myMesh( new MeshImplData ),
00083       myTags( new MeshImplTags )
00084 {}
00085 
00086 MeshImpl::~MeshImpl() 
00087 {
00088   delete myMesh;
00089   delete myTags;

00091 
00092 MeshImpl::MeshImpl(int num_nodes, int num_elem, EntityTopology entity_topology, 
00093                    const bool *fixed, const double *coords, const int *connectivity)
00094     : numCoords(3),
00095       myMesh( new MeshImplData ),
00096       myTags( new MeshImplTags )
00097 {
00098   MsqError err;
00099   myMesh->allocate_vertices( num_nodes, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00100   myMesh->allocate_elements( num_elem, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00101   
00102   // Fill in the data
00103   if (fixed) {
00104     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00105       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), fixed[i], err);
00106     }
00107   }
00108   else {
00109     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00110       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), false, err);
00111     }
00112   }
00113 
00114   const int verts_per_elem=TopologyInfo::corners(entity_topology);
00115 
00116   std::vector<long> connect(verts_per_elem);
00117   const int* conn_iter = connectivity;
00118   for (int i = 0; i < num_elem; i++, conn_iter += verts_per_elem) {
00119     std::copy( conn_iter, conn_iter + verts_per_elem, connect.begin() );
00120     myMesh->reset_element( i, connect, entity_topology, err);
00121   }
00122 }
00123 
00124 MeshImpl::MeshImpl(int num_nodes, int num_elem, const EntityTopology *element_topologies, 
00125                    const bool *fixed, const double *coords, const int *connectivity)
00126     : numCoords(3),
00127       myMesh( new MeshImplData ),
00128       myTags( new MeshImplTags )
00129 {
00130   MsqError err;
00131   myMesh->allocate_vertices( num_nodes, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00132   myMesh->allocate_elements( num_elem, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00133 
00134   // Fill in the data
00135   if (fixed) {
00136     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00137       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), fixed[i], err);
00138     }
00139   }
00140   else {
00141     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00142       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), false, err );
00143     }
00144   }
00145 
00146   int num_indices = 0;
00147   std::vector<long> connect;
00148 
00149   // Count the number of indices
00150   const int* conn_iter = connectivity;
00151   for (int i = 0; i < num_elem; ++i) {
00152     num_indices = TopologyInfo::corners( element_topologies[i] );
00153     connect.resize( num_indices );
00154     std::copy( conn_iter, conn_iter + num_indices, connect.begin() );
00155     myMesh->reset_element( i, connect, element_topologies[i], err );
00156     conn_iter += num_indices;
00157   }
00158 }

00160 void MeshImpl::clear()
00161 {
00162   myMesh->clear();
00163   myTags->clear();
00164 }

00166 void MeshImpl::set_all_fixed_flags( bool value, MsqError& err )
00167 {
00168   for (size_t i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i) {
00169     if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i)) {
00170       myMesh->fix_vertex( i, value, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00171     }
00172   }
00173 }
00174 
00175 void MeshImpl::set_all_slaved_flags( bool value, MsqError& err )
00176 {
00177   for (size_t i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i) {
00178     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00179       continue;
00180     
00181       // Get element connectivity
00182     const std::vector<size_t>& verts = myMesh->element_connectivity( i, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00183     
00184       // Get element properties
00185     EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology( i, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00186     unsigned ncorner = TopologyInfo::corners(type);
00187     
00188     for (unsigned i = 0; i < ncorner; ++i) {
00189       myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[i], false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00190     }
00191     for (unsigned i = ncorner; i < verts.size(); ++i) {
00192       myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[i], false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00193     }
00194   }
00195 }

00198 static bool is_side_boundary( MeshImplData* myMesh,
00199                               size_t elem,
00200                               unsigned side_dim,
00201                               unsigned side_num,
00202                               MsqError& err )
00203 {
00204     // Get the vertices of the side as indices into the above 'verts' list.
00205   const EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology( elem, err );
00206   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00207   unsigned n; // number of vertices 
00208   const unsigned* conn = TopologyInfo::side_vertices( type, side_dim, side_num, n, err );
00209   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00210 
00211     // start with the assumption that the side is on the bounary
00212   bool boundary = true;
00213   
00214     // get vertices in element connectivity
00215   const std::vector<size_t>& verts = myMesh->element_connectivity( elem, err );
00216   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00217 
00218     // Choose one vertex in face, and get adjacent elements to that vertex
00219   const std::vector<size_t>& elems = myMesh->vertex_adjacencies( verts[conn[0]], err );
00220   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00221 
00222     // For each adjacent element
00223   for (unsigned i = 0; i < elems.size(); ++i) {
00224       // we want *other* adjacent elements
00225     if (elems[i] == elem)
00226       continue;
00227 
00228       // skip elements of smaller dimension
00229     EntityTopology type2 = myMesh->element_topology( elems[i], err );
00230     if (TopologyInfo::dimension(type2) <= side_dim)
00231       continue;
00232 
00233       // get number of 'sides' of the appropriate dimension.
00234     const std::vector<size_t>& verts2 = myMesh->element_connectivity( elems[i], err );
00235     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00236     int sides2 = TopologyInfo::adjacent( type2, side_dim );
00237     for (int j = 0; j < sides2; ++j) {
00238       if (TopologyInfo::compare_sides( (const size_t*)arrptr(verts),  type,  side_num, 
00239                                        (const size_t*)arrptr(verts2), type2, j, 
00240                                        side_dim, err))
00241         boundary = false;
00242       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00243     }
00244   }
00245   
00246   return boundary;
00247 }

00249 
00250 void MeshImpl::set_skin_flags( bool corner_fixed_flag, 
00251                                bool midnode_fixed_flag,
00252                                bool midnode_slaved_flag,
00253                                MsqError& err )
00254 {
00255     // For each element, for each side of that element, check for
00256     // an adjacent element.
00257   for (size_t i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i) {
00258     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00259       continue;
00260     
00261       // Get element connectivity
00262     const std::vector<size_t>& verts = myMesh->element_connectivity( i, err );
00263     
00264       // Get element properties
00265     EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology( i, err );
00266     unsigned dim = TopologyInfo::dimension( type );
00267     int sides = TopologyInfo::adjacent( type, dim-1 );
00268     bool midedge, midface, midvol;
00269     TopologyInfo::higher_order( type, verts.size(), midedge, midface, midvol, err );
00270     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00271     const bool midside = (dim == 2 && midedge) || (dim == 3 && midface);
00272     const bool midsubside = dim == 3 && midedge;
00273     
00274       // For each side of the element (each edge for surface elems, 
00275       // each face for volume elements)..
00276     for (int j = 0; j < sides; ++j) {
00277         // Get the vertices of the side as indices into the above 'verts' list.
00278       unsigned n; // number of vertices 
00279       const unsigned* conn = TopologyInfo::side_vertices( type, dim-1, j, n, err );
00280       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00281      
00282         // if side is on boundary, mark side vertices appropriately
00283       bool boundary = is_side_boundary( myMesh, i, dim-1, j, err );
00284       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00285       if (boundary) {
00286           // mark corner vertices as fixed
00287         for (unsigned k = 0; k < n; ++k) {
00288           myMesh->fix_vertex( verts[conn[k]], corner_fixed_flag, err );
00289           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00290         }
00291         
00292           // mark higher-order node in center of side as fixed
00293         if (midside) {
00294           unsigned idx = TopologyInfo::higher_order_from_side( type, verts.size(), dim-1, j, err );
00295           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00296           myMesh->fix_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_fixed_flag, err );
00297           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00298           myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_slaved_flag, err );
00299           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00300         }
00301         
00302           // if side is a face, mark nodes on edges of face as fixed
00303         if (midsubside) {
00304           for (unsigned k = 0; k < n; ++k) {
00305             unsigned edge[2] = { conn[k], conn[(k+1)%n] };
00306             bool r;
00307             unsigned edge_num = TopologyInfo::find_edge( type, edge, r, err );
00308             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00309             
00310             unsigned idx = TopologyInfo::higher_order_from_side( type, verts.size(), 1, edge_num, err );
00311             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00312             myMesh->fix_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_fixed_flag, err );
00313             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00314             myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_slaved_flag, err );
00315             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00316           }
00317         }
00318       }    
00319     } // for (j in sides)
00320   } // for (i in elems)
00321 }
00322       
00323 void MeshImpl::mark_skin_fixed( MsqError& err, bool clear_existing )
00324 {
00325   if (clear_existing) {
00326     set_all_fixed_flags( false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00327   }
00328   
00329   set_skin_flags( true, true, false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00330 }
00331       
00332 static void get_field_names( const TagDescription& tag,
00333                              std::string& field_out,
00334                              std::string& member_out,
00335                              MsqError& err )
00336 {
00337   std::string::size_type idx;
00338   
00339   if (tag.vtkType != TagDescription::FIELD)
00340   {
00341     field_out = tag.name;
00342     member_out = "";
00343   }
00344   else if (!tag.member.empty())
00345   {
00346     field_out = tag.name;
00347     member_out = tag.member;
00348   }
00349     // If field is a struct, then the Mesquite tag name is a contcatenation
00350     // of the field name and the struct member name.  Extract them.
00351   else 
00352   {
00353     idx = tag.name.find(" ");
00354     if (idx == std::string::npos)
00355     {
00356       field_out = tag.name;
00357       member_out = MESQUITE_FIELD_TAG;
00358     }
00359     else
00360     {
00361       field_out = tag.name.substr(0, idx);
00362       member_out= tag.name.substr(idx+1);
00363     }
00364   }
00365   
00366   idx = field_out.find(" ");
00367   if (idx != std::string::npos)
00368     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_FORMAT,
00369        "Cannot write tag name \"%s\" containing spaces to VTK file.",
00370        field_out.c_str());
00371   
00372   idx = member_out.find(" ");
00373   if (idx != std::string::npos)
00374     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_FORMAT,
00375        "Cannot write field member name \"%s\" containing spaces to VTK file.",
00376        member_out.c_str());
00377 }

00380 void MeshImpl::write_vtk(const char* out_filename, MsqError &err)
00381 {
00382   ofstream file(out_filename);
00383   if (!file)
00384   {
00385     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::FILE_ACCESS );
00386     return;
00387   }
00388   
00389   file.precision( 10 );
00390   
00391     // Write a header
00392   file << "# vtk DataFile Version 3.0\n";
00393   file << "Mesquite Mesh\n";
00394   file << "ASCII\n";
00395   file << "DATASET UNSTRUCTURED_GRID\n";
00396   
00397     // Write vertex coordinates
00398   file << "POINTS " << myMesh->num_vertices() << " double\n";
00399 
00400   std::vector<size_t> vertex_indices( myMesh->max_vertex_index() );
00401   size_t i, count = 0;
00402   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00403   {
00404     if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
00405     {
00406       Vector3D coords = myMesh->get_vertex_coords( i, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00407       file << coords[0] << ' ' << coords[1] << ' ' << coords[2] << '\n';
00408       vertex_indices[i] = count++;
00409     }
00410     else
00411     {
00412       vertex_indices[i] = myMesh->max_vertex_index();
00413     }
00414   }
00415   
00416     // Write out the connectivity table
00417   size_t elem_idx;
00418   size_t connectivity_size = myMesh->num_elements() + myMesh->num_vertex_uses();
00419   file << "CELLS " << myMesh->num_elements() << ' ' << connectivity_size << '\n';
00420   for (elem_idx = 0; elem_idx < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++elem_idx)
00421   {
00422     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(elem_idx))
00423       continue;
00424     
00425     std::vector<size_t> conn = myMesh->element_connectivity( elem_idx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00426     EntityTopology topo = myMesh->element_topology( elem_idx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00427    
00428       // If necessary, convert from Exodus to VTK node-ordering.
00429     const VtkTypeInfo* info = VtkTypeInfo::find_type( topo, conn.size(), err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00430     if (info->msqType != POLYGON)
00431       info->mesquiteToVtkOrder( conn );
00432     
00433     file << conn.size();
00434     for (i = 0; i < conn.size(); ++i)
00435       file << ' ' << vertex_indices[(size_t)conn[i]];
00436     file << '\n';
00437   }
00438   
00439     // Write out the element types
00440   file << "CELL_TYPES " << myMesh->num_elements() << '\n';
00441   for (elem_idx = 0; elem_idx < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++elem_idx)
00442   {
00443     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(elem_idx))
00444       continue;
00445     
00446     EntityTopology topo = myMesh->element_topology( elem_idx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00447     count = myMesh->element_connectivity( elem_idx, err ).size(); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00448     const VtkTypeInfo* info = VtkTypeInfo::find_type( topo, count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
00449     file << info->vtkType << '\n';
00450   }
00451   
00452     // Write out which points are fixed.
00453   file << "POINT_DATA " << myMesh->num_vertices()
00454        << "\nSCALARS fixed int\nLOOKUP_TABLE default\n";
00455   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00456     if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid( i ))
00457       file <<( myMesh->vertex_is_fixed( i, err ) ? "1" : "0") << "\n";
00458 
00459   if (myMesh->have_slaved_flags()) {
00460     file << "SCALARS slaved int\nLOOKUP_TABLE default\n";
00461     for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00462       if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid( i ))
00463         file <<( myMesh->vertex_is_slaved( i, err ) ? "1" : "0") << "\n";
00464   }
00465 
00466     // Make pass over the list of tags to:
00467     // - Check if there are any tags on elements.
00468     // - Get the list of field names by which to group tag data.
00469     // - Assign VTK types for tags that have an unknown VTK type.
00470   MeshImplTags::TagIterator tagiter;
00471   std::multimap<std::string,size_t> fields;
00472   bool have_elem_data = false;
00473   for (tagiter = myTags->tag_begin(); tagiter != myTags->tag_end(); ++tagiter)
00474   {
00475     bool haveelem = myTags->tag_has_element_data( *tagiter, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00476     if (haveelem) 
00477       have_elem_data = true;
00478     
00479     const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties( *tagiter, err );
00480     std::string field, member;
00481     get_field_names( desc, field, member, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00482     fields.insert( std::multimap<std::string,size_t>::value_type( field, *tagiter ) );
00483   }
00484   
00485     // Write vertex tag data to vtk attributes, group by field.
00486     // We already wrote the header line for the POINT_DATA block
00487     // with the fixed flag, so just write the rest of the tags now.
00488   std::multimap<std::string,size_t>::iterator f, e;
00489   f = fields.begin();
00490   while (f != fields.end())
00491   {
00492     if (!myTags->tag_has_vertex_data( f->second, err ))
00493       { ++f; continue; }
00494     
00495     int count = 0;
00496     for (e = f; e != fields.end() && e->first == f->first; ++e)
00497       if (myTags->tag_has_vertex_data( e->second, err ))
00498         ++count;
00499     if (!count)
00500       continue;
00501     
00502     if (myTags->properties(f->second, err).vtkType == TagDescription::FIELD)
00503       file << "FIELD " << f->first << " " << count << std::endl;
00504     else if (count > 1)
00505     {
00506       MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR,
00507         "Tag name \"%s\" conflicts with VTK field name in tag \"%s\"\n",
00508         f->first.c_str(), myTags->properties((++f)->second,err).name.c_str());
00509       return;
00510     }
00511     
00512     for (; f != e; ++f)
00513     {
00514       if (!myTags->tag_has_vertex_data(f->second, err))
00515         continue;
00516       
00517       const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties(f->second,err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00518       std::vector<char> tagdata( myMesh->num_vertices() * desc.size );
00519       std::vector<char>::iterator iter = tagdata.begin();
00520       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00521       {
00522         if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
00523         {
00524           myTags->get_vertex_data( f->second, 1, &i, &*iter, err );
00525           if (err.error_code() == MsqError::TAG_NOT_FOUND) {
00526             memset( &*iter, 0, desc.size );
00527             err.clear();
00528           }
00529           else if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00530             return;
00531           iter += desc.size;
00532         }  
00533       }
00534       vtk_write_attrib_data( file, 
00535                              desc, 
00536                              arrptr(tagdata),
00537                              myMesh->num_vertices(),
00538                              err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00539     }
00540   }
00541   
00542     // If no element tags, then done
00543   if (!have_elem_data) 
00544   {
00545     file.close();
00546     return;
00547   }
00548   
00549     // Begin element data section
00550   file << "\nCELL_DATA " << myMesh->num_elements() << "\n";
00551     // Write element tag data to vtk attributes, group by field.
00552   f = fields.begin();
00553   while (f != fields.end())
00554   {
00555     if (!myTags->tag_has_element_data( f->second, err ))
00556       { ++f; continue; }
00557     
00558     int count = 0;
00559     for (e = f; e != fields.end() && e->first == f->first; ++e)
00560       if (myTags->tag_has_element_data( e->second, err ))
00561         ++count;
00562     if (!count)
00563       continue;
00564     
00565     if (myTags->properties( f->second, err ).vtkType == TagDescription::FIELD)
00566       file << "FIELD " << f->first << " " << count << std::endl;
00567     else if (count > 1)
00568     {
00569       MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR,
00570         "Tag name \"%s\" conflicts with VTK field name in tag \"%s\"\n",
00571         f->first.c_str(), myTags->properties((++f)->second,err).name.c_str());
00572       return;
00573     }
00574     
00575     for (; f != e; ++f)
00576     {
00577       if (!myTags->tag_has_element_data(f->second, err))
00578         continue;
00579       
00580       const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties(f->second,err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00581       std::vector<char> tagdata( myMesh->num_elements() * desc.size );
00582       std::vector<char>::iterator iter = tagdata.begin();
00583       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i)
00584       {
00585         if (myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00586         {
00587           myTags->get_element_data( f->second, 1, &i, &*iter, err );
00588           if (err.error_code() == MsqError::TAG_NOT_FOUND) {
00589             memset( &*iter, 0, desc.size );
00590             err.clear();
00591           }
00592           else if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00593             return;
00594           iter += desc.size;
00595         }  
00596       }
00597       vtk_write_attrib_data( file, 
00598                              desc, 
00599                              arrptr(tagdata),
00600                              myMesh->num_elements(),
00601                              err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00602     }
00603   }
00604   
00605     // Close the file
00606   file.close();
00607 }
00608 
00609 void MeshImpl::read_exodus(const char* in_filename , MsqError &err)
00610 {
00611 #ifndef MSQ_USING_EXODUS
00612   MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED );
00613   MSQ_DBGOUT(1) << "Cannot read ExodusII file: " << in_filename << "\n";
00614   return;
00615 #else
00616   
00617   clear();
00618   
00619   int app_float_size = sizeof(double);
00620   int file_float_size = 0;
00621   float exo_version = 0;
00622   int exo_err = 0;
00623   
00624     // Open the file
00625   int file_id = ex_open(in_filename, EX_READ, &app_float_size,
00626                     &file_float_size, &exo_version);
00627 
00628     // Make sure we opened the file correctly
00629   if (file_id < 0)
00630   {
00631     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::FILE_ACCESS );
00632     return;
00633   }
00634   
00635     // make sure the file is saved as doubles
00636   if (file_float_size != sizeof(double))
00637   {
00638     MSQ_SETERR(err)("File saved with float-sized reals.  Can only read files "
00639                     "saved with doubles.", MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED );
00640     return;
00641   }
00642 
00643   char title[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00644   int dim, vert_count, elem_count, block_count, ns_count, ss_count;
00645   
00646     // get info about the file
00647   exo_err = ex_get_init(file_id, title, &dim, &vert_count,
00648                         &elem_count, &block_count, &ns_count, &ss_count);
00649   if (exo_err < 0)
00650   {
00651     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to get entity counts from file.", 
00652                     MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00653     return;
00654   }
00655   
00656   myMesh->allocate_vertices( vert_count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00657   myMesh->allocate_elements( elem_count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00658   
00659     // Now fill in the data
00660   
00661     // Get the vertex coordinates
00662   std::vector<double> coords(vert_count * 3);
00663   double* x_iter = arrptr(coords);
00664   double* y_iter = &coords[vert_count];
00665   double* z_iter = &coords[2*vert_count];
00666   numCoords = dim;
00667   if (dim == 2)
00668   {
00669     exo_err = ex_get_coord( file_id, x_iter, y_iter, 0 );
00670     memset( z_iter, 0, sizeof(double)*vert_count );
00671   }
00672   else
00673   {
00674     exo_err = ex_get_coord( file_id, x_iter, y_iter, z_iter );
00675   }
00676     // Make sure it worked
00677   if (exo_err < 0)
00678   {
00679     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to retrieve vertex coordinates from file.",
00680                     MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00681     return;
00682   }
00683   
00684     // Store vertex coordinates in vertex array
00685   int i;
00686   for (i = 0; i < vert_count; ++i)
00687     myMesh->reset_vertex( i, Vector3D(*(x_iter++), *(y_iter++), *(z_iter)++), false, err );
00688   coords.clear();
00689   
00690   
00691     // Get block list
00692   std::vector<int> block_ids(block_count);
00693   exo_err = ex_get_elem_blk_ids(file_id, arrptr(block_ids));
00694   if (exo_err < 0)
00695   {
00696     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to read block IDs from file.", MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00697     return;
00698   }
00699 
00700 
00701   std::vector<int> conn;
00702   size_t index = 0;
00703   for (i = 0; i < block_count; i++)
00704   {
00705       // Get info about this block's elements
00706     char elem_type_str[MAX_STR_LENGTH];
00707     int num_block_elems, verts_per_elem, num_atts;
00708     exo_err = ex_get_elem_block(file_id, block_ids[i], elem_type_str,
00709                                 &num_block_elems, &verts_per_elem,
00710                                 &num_atts);
00711     if (exo_err < 0)
00712     {
00713       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to read parameters for block.",MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00714       return;
00715     }
00716     
00717       // Figure out which type of element we're working with
00718     EntityTopology elem_type;
00719     for (int j = 0; elem_type_str[j]; j++)
00720       elem_type_str[j] = toupper(elem_type_str[j]);
00721     if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "TRI", 3))
00722     {
00723       elem_type = TRIANGLE;
00724     }
00725     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "QUA", 3) ||
00726              !strncmp(elem_type_str, "SHE", 3))
00727     {
00728       elem_type = QUADRILATERAL;
00729     }
00730     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "HEX", 3))
00731     {
00732       elem_type = HEXAHEDRON;
00733     }
00734     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "TET", 3))
00735     {
00736       elem_type = TETRAHEDRON;
00737     }
00738     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "PYRAMID", 7))
00739     {
00740       elem_type = PYRAMID;
00741     }
00742     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "WEDGE", 5))
00743     {
00744       elem_type = PRISM;
00745     }
00746     else
00747     {
00748       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unrecognized element type in block",
00749                       MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT);
00750       continue;
00751     }
00752     
00753     if (conn.size() < (unsigned)(num_block_elems*verts_per_elem))
00754       conn.resize( num_block_elems*verts_per_elem );
00755     exo_err = ex_get_elem_conn( file_id, block_ids[i], arrptr(conn) );
00756     if (exo_err < 0)
00757     {
00758       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to read element block connectivity.",
00759                       MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00760       return;
00761     }
00762     
00763     std::vector<size_t> vertices(verts_per_elem);
00764     std::vector<int>::iterator conn_iter = conn.begin();
00765     for (const size_t end = index + num_block_elems; index < end; ++index)
00766     {
00767       for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator iter = vertices.begin();
00768            iter != vertices.end(); ++iter, ++conn_iter)
00769         *iter = *conn_iter - 1;
00770         
00771       myMesh->reset_element( index, vertices, elem_type, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
00772     }
00773   }
00774   
00775     // Finally, mark boundary nodes
00776   int num_fixed_nodes=0;
00777   int num_dist_in_set=0;
00778   if(ns_count>0){
00779     exo_err=ex_get_node_set_param(file_id,111,&num_fixed_nodes,
00780                                   &num_dist_in_set);
00781     if(exo_err<0){
00782       MSQ_PRINT(1)("\nError opening nodeset 111, no boundary nodes marked.");
00783       num_fixed_nodes=0;
00784     }
00785   }
00786   std::vector<int> fixed_nodes(num_fixed_nodes);
00787   if (num_fixed_nodes) {
00788     exo_err = ex_get_node_set(file_id, 111, arrptr(fixed_nodes));
00789     if(exo_err<0){
00790       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error retrieving fixed nodes.", MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00791     }
00792   }
00793   
00794     // See if this vertex is marked as a boundary vertex
00795   for (i=0; i < num_fixed_nodes; ++i)
00796   {
00797     myMesh->fix_vertex( fixed_nodes[i]-1, true, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
00798   }
00799 
00800     // Finish up
00801   exo_err=ex_close(file_id);
00802   if(exo_err<0)
00803     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error closing Exodus file.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00804 #endif
00805 }
00807 void MeshImpl::write_exodus(const char* out_filename, 
00808                                       MsqError &err)
00809 {
00810     //just return an error if we don't have access to exodus
00811 #ifndef MSQ_USING_EXODUS
00812   MSQ_SETERR(err)("Exodus not enabled in this build of Mesquite",
00813                   MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED);
00814   MSQ_DBGOUT(1) << "Cannot read ExodusII file: " << out_filename << "\n";
00815   return;
00816 #else
00817   size_t i, j, k;
00818   if (!myMesh || !myMesh->num_vertices())
00819   {
00820     MSQ_SETERR(err)("No vertices in MeshImpl.  Nothing written to file.", 
00821                     MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00822     return;
00823   }
00824     //get some element info
00825     //We need to know how many of each element type we have.  We
00826     //are going to create an element block for each element type
00827     //that exists the mesh.  Block 1 will be tri3; block 2 will be
00828     //shell; block 3 will be tetra, and block 4 will be hex.
00829   const unsigned MAX_NODES = 27;
00830   const unsigned MIN_NODES = 2;
00831   int counts[MIXED][MAX_NODES+1];
00832   memset( counts, 0, sizeof(counts) );
00833   
00834   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i)
00835   {
00836     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00837       continue;
00838     
00839     EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology(i, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00840     unsigned nodes = myMesh->element_connectivity(i, err).size(); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00841     if ((unsigned)type >= MIXED || nodes < MIN_NODES || nodes > MAX_NODES)
00842     {
00843       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Invalid element typology.", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00844       return;
00845     }
00846     ++counts[type][nodes];
00847   }
00848   
00849     // Count number of required element blocks
00850   int block_count = 0;
00851   for (i = 0; i < MIXED; ++i)
00852     for (j = MIN_NODES; j < MAX_NODES; ++j)
00853       if (counts[i][j])
00854         ++block_count;
00855 
00856     //figure out if we have fixed nodes, if so, we need a nodeset
00857   int num_fixed_nodes=0;
00858   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00859   {
00860     bool fixed = myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i) &&
00861                  myMesh->vertex_is_fixed(i, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00862     num_fixed_nodes += fixed;
00863   }
00864   
00865   
00866     //write doubles instead of floats
00867   int app_float_size = sizeof(double);
00868   int file_float_size = sizeof(double);
00869   int exo_err = 0;
00870   
00871     // Create the file.  If it exists, clobber it.  This could be dangerous.
00872   int file_id = ex_create(out_filename, EX_CLOBBER, &app_float_size,
00873                           &file_float_size);
00874 
00875     // Make sure we opened the file correctly
00876   if (file_id < 0)
00877   {
00878     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_ACCESS);
00879     return;
00880   }
00881   
00882   char title[MAX_LINE_LENGTH]="Mesquite Export";
00883   
00884   size_t vert_count = myMesh->num_vertices();
00885   size_t elem_count = myMesh->num_elements();
00886   
00887   int ns_count=0;
00888   if(num_fixed_nodes>0)
00889     ns_count=1;
00890   int ss_count=0;
00891   
00892     // put the initial info about the file
00893   exo_err = ex_put_init(file_id, title, numCoords, vert_count,
00894                         elem_count, block_count, ns_count, ss_count);
00895   if (exo_err < 0)
00896   {
00897     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to initialize file data.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00898     return;
00899   }
00900   
00901   
00902     // Gather vertex coordinate data and write to file.
00903   std::vector<double> coords(vert_count * 3);
00904   std::vector<double>::iterator x, y, z;
00905   x = coords.begin();
00906   y = x + vert_count;
00907   z = y + vert_count;
00908   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00909   {
00910     if (!myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
00911       continue;
00912     
00913     if (z == coords.end())
00914     {
00915       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Array overflow", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00916       return;
00917     }
00918     
00919     Vector3D coords = myMesh->get_vertex_coords(i, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00920     *x = coords.x(); ++x;
00921     *y = coords.y(); ++y;
00922     *z = coords.z(); ++z;
00923   }
00924   if(z != coords.end())
00925   {
00926     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Counter at incorrect number.", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00927     return;
00928   }
00929     //put the coords
00930   exo_err = ex_put_coord(file_id, arrptr(coords), &coords[vert_count], &coords[2*vert_count]);
00931   if (exo_err < 0)
00932   {
00933     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to put vertex coordinates in file.",MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00934     return;
00935   } 
00936 
00937     //put the names of the coordinates
00938   char* coord_names[] = { "x", "y", "z" };
00939   exo_err = ex_put_coord_names(file_id, coord_names);
00940   
00941     // Create element-type arrays indexed by EntityTopology
00942   const char* tri_name = "TRI";
00943   const char* quad_name = "SHELL";
00944   const char* tet_name = "TETRA";
00945   const char* hex_name = "HEX";
00946   const char* wdg_name = "WEDGE";
00947   const char* pyr_name = "PYRAMID";
00948   const char* exo_names[MIXED];
00949   memset( exo_names, 0, sizeof(exo_names) );
00950   exo_names[TRIANGLE]      = tri_name;
00951   exo_names[QUADRILATERAL] = quad_name;
00952   exo_names[TETRAHEDRON]   = tet_name;
00953   exo_names[HEXAHEDRON]    = hex_name;
00954   exo_names[PRISM]         = wdg_name;
00955   exo_names[PYRAMID]       = pyr_name;
00956   unsigned min_nodes[MIXED];
00957   memset( min_nodes, 0, sizeof(min_nodes) );
00958   min_nodes[TRIANGLE]      = 3;
00959   min_nodes[QUADRILATERAL] = 4;
00960   min_nodes[TETRAHEDRON]   = 4;
00961   min_nodes[HEXAHEDRON]    = 8;
00962   min_nodes[PRISM]         = 6;
00963   min_nodes[PYRAMID]       = 5;
00964   
00965     // For each element type (topology and num nodes)
00966   int block_id = 0;
00967   char name_buf[16];
00968   int num_atts = 0;
00969   std::vector<int> conn;
00970   for (i = 0; i < MIXED; ++i)
00971   {
00972     for (j = MIN_NODES; j < MAX_NODES; ++j)
00973     {
00974         // Have any of this topo & count combination?
00975       if (!counts[i][j])
00976         continue;
00977       
00978         // Is a supported ExodusII type?
00979       if (!exo_names[i])
00980       {
00981         MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INVALID_STATE,
00982           "Element topology %d not supported by ExodusII", (int)i );
00983         return;
00984       }
00985       
00986         // Construct ExodusII element name from topo & num nodes
00987       if (j == min_nodes[i])
00988         strcpy( name_buf, exo_names[i] );
00989       else
00990         sprintf( name_buf, "%s%d", exo_names[i], (int)j );
00991       
00992         // Create element block
00993       ++block_id;
00994       exo_err = ex_put_elem_block( file_id, block_id, name_buf, 
00995                                    counts[i][j], j, num_atts );
00996       if(exo_err<0)
00997       {
00998         MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error creating the tri block.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00999         return;
01000       }
01001       
01002         // For each element
01003       conn.resize( counts[i][j] * j );
01004       std::vector<int>::iterator iter = conn.begin();
01005       for (k = 0; k < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++k)
01006       {
01007           // If not correct topo, skip it.
01008         if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(k) ||
01009              (unsigned)(myMesh->element_topology(k, err)) != i)
01010           continue;
01011         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01012         
01013           // If not correct number nodes, skip it
01014         const std::vector<size_t>& elem_conn = myMesh->element_connectivity(k, err);
01015         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01016         if (elem_conn.size() != j)
01017           continue;
01018         
01019           // Append element connectivity to list
01020         for (std::vector<size_t>::const_iterator citer = elem_conn.begin();
01021              citer != elem_conn.end(); ++citer, ++iter)
01022         {
01023           assert(iter != conn.end());
01024           *iter = *citer + 1;
01025         }
01026       }
01027 
01028         // Make sure everything adds up
01029       if (iter != conn.end())
01030       {
01031         MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR );
01032         return;
01033       }
01034 
01035         // Write element block connectivity
01036       exo_err = ex_put_elem_conn( file_id, block_id, arrptr(conn) );
01037       if (exo_err<0)
01038       {
01039         MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error writing element connectivity.", MsqError::IO_ERROR );
01040         return;
01041       }
01042     }
01043   }  
01044  
01045     // Finally, mark boundary nodes
01046   
01047   if(num_fixed_nodes>0){
01048     exo_err=ex_put_node_set_param(file_id, 111, num_fixed_nodes, 0);
01049     if(exo_err<0) {
01050       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error while initializing node set.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
01051       return;
01052     }
01053     
01054     int node_id = 0;
01055     std::vector<int> fixed_nodes( num_fixed_nodes );
01056     std::vector<int>::iterator iter = fixed_nodes.begin();
01057     for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01058     {
01059       if (!myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
01060         continue;
01061       ++node_id;
01062       
01063       if (myMesh->vertex_is_fixed( i, err ))
01064       {
01065         if (iter == fixed_nodes.end())
01066         {
01067           MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
01068           return;
01069         }
01070         *iter = node_id;
01071         ++iter;
01072       }
01073     }
01074     
01075     if (iter != fixed_nodes.end())
01076     {
01077       MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
01078       return;
01079     }
01080 
01081     exo_err=ex_put_node_set(file_id, 111, arrptr(fixed_nodes));
01082     if(exo_err<0) {
01083       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error while writing node set.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
01084       return;
01085     }
01086   }
01087   exo_err=ex_close(file_id);
01088   if(exo_err<0)
01089     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error closing Exodus file.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
01090   
01091 #endif
01092 }
01093 
01094 // Returns whether this mesh lies in a 2D or 3D coordinate system.
01095 
01096 int MeshImpl::get_geometric_dimension(MsqError &/*err*/)
01097 {
01098   return numCoords;
01099 }
01100 
01101 
01102 void MeshImpl::get_all_elements( std::vector<ElementHandle>& elems,
01103                                  MsqError& err )
01104 {
01105   assert( sizeof(ElementHandle) == sizeof(size_t) );
01106   std::vector<size_t> temp;
01107   myMesh->all_elements( temp, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01108   elems.resize( temp.size() );
01109   if (!elems.empty())
01110     memcpy( arrptr(elems), arrptr(temp), sizeof(size_t)*temp.size() );
01111 }
01112 
01113 void MeshImpl::get_all_vertices( std::vector<VertexHandle>& verts,
01114                                  MsqError& err )
01115 {
01116   assert( sizeof(VertexHandle) == sizeof(size_t) );
01117   std::vector<size_t> temp;
01118   myMesh->all_vertices( temp, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01119   verts.resize( temp.size() );
01120   if (!verts.empty())
01121     memcpy( arrptr(verts), arrptr(temp), sizeof(size_t)*temp.size() );
01122 }
01123 
01124 // Returns a pointer to an iterator that iterates over the
01125 // set of all vertices in this mesh.  The calling code should
01126 // delete the returned iterator when it is finished with it.
01127 // If vertices are added or removed from the Mesh after obtaining
01128 // an iterator, the behavior of that iterator is undefined.
01129 VertexIterator* MeshImpl::vertex_iterator(MsqError &/*err*/)
01130 {
01131   return new MeshImplVertIter( myMesh );
01132 }
01133     
01134 // Returns a pointer to an iterator that iterates over the
01135 // set of all top-level elements in this mesh.  The calling code should
01136 // delete the returned iterator when it is finished with it.
01137 // If elements are added or removed from the Mesh after obtaining
01138 // an iterator, the behavior of that iterator is undefined.
01139 ElementIterator* MeshImpl::element_iterator(MsqError &/*err*/)
01140 {
01141   return new MeshImplElemIter( myMesh );
01142 }
01143 
01144 //************ Vertex Properties ********************
01145 // Returns true or false, indicating whether the vertex
01146 // is allowed to be repositioned.  True indicates that the vertex
01147 // is fixed and cannot be moved.  Note that this is a read-only
01148 // property; this flag can't be modified by users of the
01149 // Mesh interface.
01150 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_fixed_flag(
01151  const VertexHandle vert_array[], 
01152  std::vector<bool>& on_bnd,
01153  size_t num_vtx, MsqError& err)
01154 {
01155   on_bnd.resize(num_vtx);
01156   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i)
01157   {
01158     on_bnd[i] = myMesh->vertex_is_fixed( (size_t)vert_array[i], err ); 
01159     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01160   }
01161 }
01162 
01163 void MeshImpl::vertices_set_fixed_flag(
01164  const VertexHandle vert_array[], 
01165  const std::vector<bool>& on_bnd,
01166  size_t num_vtx, MsqError& err)
01167 {
01168   assert(on_bnd.size() >= num_vtx);
01169   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i)
01170   {
01171     myMesh->fix_vertex( (size_t)vert_array[i], on_bnd[i],  err ); 
01172     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01173   }
01174 }
01175 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_slaved_flag(
01176  const VertexHandle vert_array[], 
01177  std::vector<bool>& flags,
01178  size_t num_vtx, MsqError& err)
01179 {
01180   flags.resize(num_vtx);
01181   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i)
01182   {
01183     flags[i] = myMesh->vertex_is_slaved( (size_t)vert_array[i], err ); 
01184     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01185   }
01186 }

01189 // Get/set location of a vertex
01190 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_coordinates(
01191  const Mesh::VertexHandle vert_array[],
01192  MsqVertex* coordinates,
01193   size_t num_vtx,
01194  MsqError& err)
01195 {
01196   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i) {
01197     coordinates[i] = myMesh->get_vertex_coords( (size_t)vert_array[i], err );
01198     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01199   }
01200 }

01203 
01204 void MeshImpl::vertex_set_coordinates(
01205   VertexHandle vertex,
01206   const Vector3D &coordinates,
01207   MsqError& err)
01208 {
01209   myMesh->set_vertex_coords( (size_t)vertex, coordinates, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01210 }
01211 
01212 // Each vertex has a byte-sized flag that can be used to store
01213 // flags.  This byte's value is neither set nor used by the mesh
01214 // implementation.  It is intended to be used by Mesquite algorithms.
01215 // Until a vertex's byte has been explicitly set, its value is 0.
01216 void MeshImpl::vertex_set_byte ( VertexHandle vertex,
01217                                            unsigned char byte,
01218                                            MsqError& err)
01219 {
01220   vertices_set_byte( &vertex, &byte, 1, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01221 }
01222 
01223 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_byte ( const VertexHandle *vert_array,
01224                                    unsigned char *byte_array,
01225                                    size_t array_size,
01226                                    MsqError& err)
01227 {
01228   for (size_t i = 0; i < array_size; i++)
01229   {
01230     byte_array[i] = myMesh->get_vertex_byte( (size_t)vert_array[i], err ); 
01231     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01232   }
01233 }
01234 
01235 // Retrieve the byte value for the specified vertex or vertices.
01236 // The byte value is 0 if it has not yet been set via one of the
01237 // *_set_byte() functions.
01238 void MeshImpl::vertex_get_byte( const VertexHandle vertex,
01239                                 unsigned char *byte,
01240                                 MsqError &err )
01241 {
01242   vertices_get_byte( &vertex, byte, 1, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01243 }
01244 
01245 void MeshImpl::vertices_set_byte( const VertexHandle *vertex,
01246                                   const unsigned char *byte_array,
01247                                   size_t array_size,
01248                                   MsqError& err)
01249 {
01250   for (size_t i = 0; i < array_size; i++)
01251   {
01252     myMesh->set_vertex_byte( (size_t)vertex[i], byte_array[i], err );
01253     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01254   }

01256 
01257 template <typename T> struct cast_handle : public std::unary_function<size_t, T>
01258 { 
01259 T operator()( size_t idx ) const 
01260 { 
01261   return reinterpret_cast<T>(idx); 
01262 } 
01263 
01264 };
01265 
01266 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_attached_elements( const VertexHandle* vertices,
01267                                                size_t num_vertices,
01268                                                std::vector<ElementHandle>& elements,
01269                                                std::vector<size_t>& offsets,
01270                                                MsqError& err )
01271 {
01272   elements.clear();
01273   offsets.clear();
01274   size_t prev_offset = 0;
01275   offsets.reserve( num_vertices + 1 );
01276   offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01277   const VertexHandle *const vtx_end = vertices + num_vertices;
01278   for (; vertices < vtx_end; ++vertices) {
01279     const std::vector<size_t>& adj 
01280       = myMesh->vertex_adjacencies( (size_t)*vertices, err );
01281     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01282     
01283     prev_offset = prev_offset + adj.size();
01284     offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01285     
01286     std::transform( adj.begin(), adj.end(), std::back_inserter( elements ), cast_handle<ElementHandle>() );
01287   }
01288 }
01289 
01290 
01291 
01292 void MeshImpl::elements_get_attached_vertices( const ElementHandle *elements,
01293                                                size_t num_elems,
01294                                                std::vector<VertexHandle>& vertices,
01295                                                std::vector<size_t>& offsets,
01296                                                MsqError &err) 
01297 {
01298   vertices.clear();
01299   offsets.clear();
01300   size_t prev_offset = 0;
01301   offsets.reserve( num_elems + 1 );
01302   offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01303   const ElementHandle *const elem_end = elements + num_elems;
01304   for (; elements < elem_end; ++elements) {
01305     const std::vector<size_t>& conn 
01306       = myMesh->element_connectivity( (size_t)*elements, err );
01307     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01308     
01309     prev_offset = prev_offset + conn.size();
01310     offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01311     
01312     std::transform( conn.begin(), conn.end(), std::back_inserter( vertices ), cast_handle<VertexHandle>() );
01313   }
01314 }
01315 
01316 // Returns the topologies of the given entities.  The "entity_topologies"
01317 // array must be at least "num_elements" in size.
01318 void MeshImpl::elements_get_topologies( const ElementHandle *element_handle_array,
01319                                         EntityTopology *element_topologies,
01320                                         size_t num_elements,
01321                                         MsqError& err)
01322 {
01323   for (size_t i = 0; i < num_elements; i++)
01324   {
01325     element_topologies[i] = myMesh->
01326       element_topology( (size_t)element_handle_array[i], err );
01327     MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01328   }
01329 }

01335 //**************** Memory Management ****************
01336 // Tells the mesh that the client is finished with a given
01337 // entity handle.  
01338 void MeshImpl::release_entity_handles(
01339   const EntityHandle* /*handle_array*/,
01340   size_t /*num_handles*/,
01341   MsqError &/*err*/)
01342 {
01343     // Do nothing
01344 }

01346 // Instead of deleting a Mesh when you think you are done,
01347 // call release().  In simple cases, the implementation could
01348 // just call the destructor.  More sophisticated implementations
01349 // may want to keep the Mesh object to live longer than Mesquite
01350 // is using it.
01351 void MeshImpl::release()
01352 {
01353   //delete this;
01354 }
