01356 
01357 
01358 const char* const vtk_type_names[] = { "bit",
01359                                        "char",
01360                                        "unsigned_char",
01361                                        "short",
01362                                        "unsigned_short",
01363                                        "int",
01364                                        "unsigned_int",
01365                                        "long",
01366                                        "unsigned_long",
01367                                        "float",
01368                                        "double",
01369                                        0 };
01370 
01371 void MeshImpl::read_vtk( const char* filename, MsqError &err )
01372 {
01373   int major, minor;
01374   char vendor_string[257];
01375   size_t i;
01376   
01377   FILE* file = fopen( filename, "r" );
01378   if (!file)
01379   {
01380     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_ACCESS);
01381     return;
01382   }
01383   
01384     // Read file header
01385     
01386   if (!fgets( vendor_string, sizeof(vendor_string), file ))
01387   {
01388     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::IO_ERROR );
01389     fclose( file );
01390     return;
01391   }
01392   
01393   if (!strchr( vendor_string, '\n' ) ||
01394       2 != sscanf( vendor_string, "# vtk DataFile Version %d.%d", &major, &minor ))
01395   {
01396     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::FILE_FORMAT );
01397     fclose( file );
01398     return;
01399   }
01400   
01401   if (!fgets( vendor_string, sizeof(vendor_string), file )) 
01402   {
01403     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::IO_ERROR );
01404     fclose( file );
01405     return;
01406   }
01407   
01408     // VTK spec says this should not exceed 256 chars.
01409   if (!strchr( vendor_string, '\n' ))
01410   {
01411     MSQ_SETERR(err)( "Vendor string (line 2) exceeds 256 characters.",
01412                       MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
01413     fclose( file );
01414     return;
01415   }
01416   
01417   
01418     // Check file type
01419   
01420   FileTokenizer tokens( file );
01421   const char* const file_type_names[] = { "ASCII", "BINARY", 0 };
01422   int filetype = tokens.match_token( file_type_names, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01423   if (2 == filetype) {
01424     MSQ_SETERR(err)( "Cannot read BINARY VTK files -- use ASCII.",
01425                      MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED );
01426     return;
01427   }
01428 
01429     // Clear any existing data
01430   this->clear();
01431 
01432   const char* outer_block_names[] = { "DATASET", "FIELD", 0 };
01433     // Read the mesh
01434     // VTK docs are inconsistant with regard to whether or not 
01435     // a field block should be specified as "FIELD" or "DATASET FIELD",
01436     // so allow both.
01437   while (!tokens.eof()) 
01438   {
01439     int blocktype = tokens.match_token( outer_block_names, err ); 
01440     if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) 
01441     {
01442       if (tokens.eof())
01443       {
01444         err.clear();
01445         break;
01446       }
01447       else
01448         return;
01449     }
01450     
01451     if (blocktype == 1)
01452     {
01453       vtk_read_dataset( tokens, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01454     }
01455     else
01456     {
01457       vtk_read_field( tokens, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01458     }
01459   }
01460   
01461     // Make sure file actually contained some mesh
01462   if (myMesh->num_elements() == 0)
01463   {
01464     MSQ_SETERR(err)("File contained no mesh.", MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
01465     return;
01466   }
01467   
01468     // There is no option for a 2-D mesh in VTK files.  Always 3
01469   numCoords = 3;
01470 
01471     // Convert tag data for fixed nodes to internal bitmap
01472   std::vector<bool> flags;
01473   tag_to_bool( "fixed", flags, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01474   if (!flags.empty()) {
01475     for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01476       myMesh->fix_vertex( i, flags[i], err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01477   }
01478   
01479   flags.clear();
01480   tag_to_bool( "slaved", flags, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01481   if (!flags.empty()) {
01482     for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01483       myMesh->slave_vertex( i, flags[i], err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01484   }
01485 }
01486 
01487 void MeshImpl::tag_to_bool( const char* tag_name, 
01488                             std::vector<bool>& values,
01489                             MsqError& err )
01490 {
01491     // Convert tag data for fixed nodes to internal bitmap
01492   TagHandle handle = tag_get( tag_name, err );
01493   if (!handle || MSQ_CHKERR(err)) {
01494     err.clear();
01495     values.clear();
01496     return;
01497   }
01498   
01499   size_t i;
01500   values.resize( myMesh->max_vertex_index(), false );
01501   const TagDescription& tag_desc = myTags->properties( (size_t)handle, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01502   bool havedata = myTags->tag_has_vertex_data( (size_t)handle, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01503   if (!havedata)
01504   {
01505     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_FORMAT, "'%s' attribute on elements, not vertices", tag_name);
01506     return;
01507   }
01508 
01509   switch( tag_desc.type )
01510   {
01511     case BYTE:
01512     {
01513       char data;
01514       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01515       {
01516         myTags->get_vertex_data( (size_t)handle, 1, &i, &data, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01517         values[i] = !!data;
01518       }
01519       break;
01520     }
01521     case BOOL:
01522     {
01523       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01524       {
01525         bool data;
01526         myTags->get_vertex_data( (size_t)handle, 1, &i, &data, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01527         values[i] = data;
01528       }
01529       break;
01530     }
01531     case INT:
01532     {
01533       int data;
01534       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01535       {
01536         myTags->get_vertex_data( (size_t)handle, 1, &i, &data, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01537         values[i] = !!data;
01538       }
01539       break;
01540     }
01541     case DOUBLE:
01542     {
01543       double data;
01544       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01545       {
01546         myTags->get_vertex_data( (size_t)handle, 1, &i, &data, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01547         values[i] = !!data;
01548       }
01549       break;
01550     }
01551     case HANDLE:
01552     {
01553       unsigned long data;
01554       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01555       {
01556         myTags->get_vertex_data( (size_t)handle, 1, &i, &data, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01557         values[i] = !!data;
01558       }
01559       break;
01560     }
01561     default:
01562       MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::PARSE_ERROR, "'%s' attribute has invalid type", tag_name);
01563       return;
01564   }
01565   
01566   tag_delete( handle, err );
01567 }
01568 
01569 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_dataset( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
01570 {
01571   const char* const data_type_names[] = { "STRUCTURED_POINTS",
01572                                           "STRUCTURED_GRID",
01573                                           "UNSTRUCTURED_GRID",
01574                                           "POLYDATA",
01575                                           "RECTILINEAR_GRID",
01576                                           "FIELD",
01577                                           0 };
01578   int datatype = tokens.match_token( data_type_names, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01579   
01580   
01581     // Ignore FIELD data at beginning of DATASET. As far as I (J.Kraftcheck)
01582     // understand the VTK documentation, there should never be a FIELD block
01583     // inside a dataset, except in attribute data.  However, some app somewhere
01584     // writes them this way, so try to handle them.
01585   for (;;)
01586   {
01587     tokens.match_token( "FIELD", err );
01588     if (err) 
01589     {
01590       tokens.unget_token();
01591       err.clear();
01592       break;
01593     }
01594     vtk_read_field( tokens, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01595   }
01596     
01597   
01598   switch( datatype )
01599   {
01600     case 1: vtk_read_structured_points( tokens, err ); break;
01601     case 2: vtk_read_structured_grid  ( tokens, err ); break;
01602     case 3: vtk_read_unstructured_grid( tokens, err ); break;
01603     case 4: vtk_read_polydata         ( tokens, err ); break;
01604     case 5: vtk_read_rectilinear_grid ( tokens, err ); break;
01605     case 6: vtk_read_field            ( tokens, err ); break;
01606   }
01607 
01608   
01609     // Read attribute data 
01610   const char* const block_type_names[] = { "POINT_DATA", "CELL_DATA", "DATASET", 0 };
01611   int blocktype = 0;
01612   while (!tokens.eof())
01613   {
01614       // get POINT_DATA or CELL_DATA
01615     int new_block_type = tokens.match_token( block_type_names, err );
01616     if (new_block_type == 3) // done reading attributes
01617     {
01618       tokens.unget_token();
01619       return;
01620     }
01621     
01622     if (err)
01623     {
01624       if (tokens.eof())
01625       {
01626         err.clear();
01627         break;
01628       }
01629         // If next token was neither POINT_DATA nor CELL_DATA,
01630         // then there's another attribute under the current one.
01631       if (blocktype)
01632       {
01633         tokens.unget_token();
01634         err.clear();
01635       }
01636       else
01637       {
01638         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01639       }
01640     }
01641     else
01642     {
01643       blocktype = new_block_type;
01644       long count;
01645       tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &count, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01646       
01647       if (blocktype == 1 && (unsigned long)count != myMesh->num_vertices())
01648       {
01649         MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01650                          "Count inconsistent with number of vertices" 
01651                          " at line %d.", tokens.line_number());
01652         return;
01653       }
01654       else if (blocktype == 2 && (unsigned long)count != myMesh->num_elements())
01655       {
01656          MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01657                          "Count inconsistent with number of elements" 
01658                          " at line %d.", tokens.line_number());
01659         return;
01660       }
01661     }
01662       
01663    
01664     if (blocktype == 1)
01665       vtk_read_point_data( tokens, err );
01666     else
01667       vtk_read_cell_data ( tokens, err );
01668     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01669   }
01670 }
01671 
01672 
01673 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_structured_points( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
01674 {
01675   long i, j, k;
01676   long dims[3];
01677   double origin[3], space[3];
01678  
01679   tokens.match_token( "DIMENSIONS", err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01680   tokens.get_long_ints( 3, dims, err );    MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01681   tokens.get_newline( err );               MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01682   
01683   if (dims[0] < 1 || dims[1] < 1 || dims[2] < 1)
01684   {
01685     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01686                    "Invalid dimension at line %d", 
01687                    tokens.line_number());
01688     return;
01689   }
01690   
01691   tokens.match_token( "ORIGIN", err );     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01692   tokens.get_doubles( 3, origin, err );    MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01693   tokens.get_newline( err );               MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01694   
01695   const char* const spacing_names[] = { "SPACING", "ASPECT_RATIO", 0 };
01696   tokens.match_token( spacing_names, err );MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01697   tokens.get_doubles( 3, space, err );     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01698   tokens.get_newline( err );               MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01699   
01700   myMesh->allocate_vertices( dims[0]*dims[1]*dims[2], err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01701   size_t vtx = 0;
01702   Vector3D off( origin[0], origin[1], origin[2] );
01703   for (k = 0; k < dims[2]; ++k)
01704     for (j = 0; j < dims[1]; ++j)
01705       for (i = 0; i < dims[0]; ++i)
01706       {
01707         myMesh->reset_vertex( vtx++, off + Vector3D( i*space[0], j*space[1], k*space[2] ), false, err ); 
01708         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01709       }
01710 
01711   vtk_create_structured_elems( dims, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01712 }
01713 
01714 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_structured_grid( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
01715 {
01716   long num_verts, dims[3];
01717  
01718   tokens.match_token( "DIMENSIONS", err );   MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01719   tokens.get_long_ints( 3, dims, err );      MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01720   tokens.get_newline( err );                 MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
01721   
01722   if (dims[0] < 1 || dims[1] < 1 || dims[2] < 1)
01723   {
01724     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01725                    "Invalid dimension at line %d", 
01726                    tokens.line_number());
01727     return;
01728   }
01729   
01730   tokens.match_token( "POINTS", err );        MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
01731   tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &num_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
01732   tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
01733   tokens.get_newline( err );                  MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
01734   
01735   if (num_verts != (dims[0] * dims[1] * dims[2]))
01736   {
01737     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01738                     "Point count not consistent with dimensions "
01739                     "at line %d", tokens.line_number() );
01740     return;
01741   }
01742   
01743   myMesh->allocate_vertices( num_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01744   for (size_t vtx = 0; vtx < (size_t)num_verts; ++vtx)
01745   {
01746     Vector3D pos;
01747     tokens.get_doubles( 3, const_cast<double*>(pos.to_array()), err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01748     myMesh->reset_vertex( vtx, pos, false, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01749   }
01750  
01751   vtk_create_structured_elems( dims, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01752 }
01753 
01754 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_rectilinear_grid( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
01755 {
01756   int i, j, k;
01757   long dims[3];
01758   const char* labels[] = { "X_COORDINATES", "Y_COORDINATES", "Z_COORDINATES" };
01759   vector<double> coords[3];
01760   
01761   tokens.match_token( "DIMENSIONS", err );                   MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01762   tokens.get_long_ints( 3, dims, err );                     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01763   tokens.get_newline( err );                                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01764   
01765   if (dims[0] < 1 || dims[1] < 1 || dims[2] < 1)
01766   {
01767      MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01768                    "Invalid dimension at line %d", 
01769                    tokens.line_number());
01770     return;
01771   }
01772 
01773   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01774   {
01775     long count;
01776     tokens.match_token( labels[i], err );                   MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01777     tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &count, err );                 MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01778     tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );              MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01779     tokens.get_newline( err );                              MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01780     
01781     if (count != dims[i])
01782     {
01783       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01784                        "Coordinate count inconsistent with dimensions"
01785                        " at line %d", tokens.line_number());
01786       return;
01787     }
01788     
01789     coords[i].resize(count);
01790     tokens.get_doubles( count, &coords[i][0], err );   MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01791   }
01792   
01793   myMesh->allocate_vertices( dims[0]*dims[1]*dims[2], err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01794   size_t vtx = 0;
01795   for (k = 0; k < dims[2]; ++k)
01796     for (j = 0; j < dims[1]; ++j)
01797       for (i = 0; i < dims[0]; ++i)
01798       {
01799         myMesh->reset_vertex( vtx++, Vector3D( coords[0][i], coords[1][j], coords[2][k] ), false, err );
01800         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01801       }
01802   
01803   
01804   vtk_create_structured_elems( dims, err );                 MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01805 }
01806 
01807 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_polydata( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
01808 {
01809   long num_verts;
01810   vector<int> connectivity;
01811   const char* const poly_data_names[] = { "VERTICES",
01812                                           "LINES",
01813                                           "POLYGONS",
01814                                           "TRIANGLE_STRIPS", 
01815                                           0 };
01816   
01817   tokens.match_token( "POINTS", err );                      MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01818   tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &num_verts, err );               MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01819   tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01820   tokens.get_newline( err );                                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01821   
01822   if (num_verts < 1)
01823   {
01824     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01825                      "Invalid point count at line %d", tokens.line_number());
01826     return;
01827   }
01828   
01829   myMesh->allocate_vertices( num_verts, err );              MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01830   for (size_t vtx = 0; vtx < (size_t)num_verts; ++vtx)
01831   {
01832     Vector3D pos;
01833     tokens.get_doubles( 3, const_cast<double*>(pos.to_array()), err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01834     myMesh->reset_vertex( vtx, pos, false, err );           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01835   }
01836 
01837   int poly_type = tokens.match_token( poly_data_names, err );MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01838   switch (poly_type)
01839   {
01840     case 3:
01841       vtk_read_polygons( tokens, err );                     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01842       break;
01843     case 4:
01844       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED, 
01845                        "Unsupported type: triangle strips at line %d",
01846                        tokens.line_number() );
01847       return;
01848     case 1:
01849     case 2:
01850       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED, 
01851                        "Entities of dimension < 2 at line %d",
01852                        tokens.line_number() );
01853       return;
01854   }
01855 }
01856 
01857 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_polygons( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
01858 {
01859   long size[2];
01860   
01861   tokens.get_long_ints( 2, size, err );                     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01862   tokens.get_newline( err );                                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01863   myMesh->allocate_elements( size[0], err );                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01864   std::vector<long> conn;
01865 
01866   for (int i = 0; i < size[0]; ++i)
01867   {
01868     long count;
01869     tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &count, err );                 MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01870     conn.resize( count );
01871     tokens.get_long_ints( count, arrptr(conn), err );    MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01872     myMesh->reset_element( i, conn, POLYGON, err );         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01873   } 
01874 }
01875 
01876 
01877 
01878 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_unstructured_grid( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
01879 {
01880   long i, num_verts, num_elems[2];
01881   
01882   tokens.match_token( "POINTS", err );                      MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01883   tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &num_verts, err );               MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01884   tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01885   tokens.get_newline( err );                                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01886   
01887   if (num_verts < 1)
01888   {
01889     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01890                      "Invalid point count at line %d", tokens.line_number());
01891     return;
01892   }
01893   
01894   myMesh->allocate_vertices( num_verts, err );              MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01895   for (size_t vtx = 0; vtx < (size_t)num_verts; ++vtx)
01896   {
01897     Vector3D pos;
01898     tokens.get_doubles( 3, const_cast<double*>(pos.to_array()), err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01899     myMesh->reset_vertex( vtx, pos, false, err );           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01900   }
01901   
01902   tokens.match_token( "CELLS", err );                       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01903   tokens.get_long_ints( 2, num_elems, err );                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01904   tokens.get_newline( err );                                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01905 
01906   myMesh->allocate_elements( num_elems[0], err );           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01907   std::vector<long> conn;
01908   for (i = 0; i < num_elems[0]; ++i)
01909   {
01910     long count;
01911     tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &count, err);                  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01912     conn.resize( count );
01913     tokens.get_long_ints( count, arrptr(conn), err );    MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01914     myMesh->reset_element( i, conn, MIXED, err );           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01915   }
01916  
01917   tokens.match_token( "CELL_TYPES", err );                  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01918   tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &num_elems[1], err );            MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01919   tokens.get_newline( err );                                MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01920   
01921   if (num_elems[0] != num_elems[1])
01922   {
01923     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01924                     "Number of element types does not match number of elements"
01925                     "at line %d", tokens.line_number() );
01926     return;
01927   }
01928   
01929   std::vector<size_t> tconn;
01930   for (i = 0; i < num_elems[0]; ++i)
01931   {
01932     long type;
01933     size_t size;
01934     tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &type, err );                      MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01935 
01936       // Check if type is a valid value
01937     const VtkTypeInfo* info = VtkTypeInfo::find_type( type, err );   
01938     if (err || !info || (!info->numNodes && type != POLYGON) )
01939     {
01940       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
01941                        "Invalid cell type %ld at line %d.",
01942                        type, tokens.line_number() );
01943       return;
01944     }
01945       // Check if Mesquite supports the type
01946     if (info->msqType == MIXED)
01947     {
01948       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT,
01949                        "Unsupported cell type %ld (%s) at line %d.",
01950                        type, info->name, tokens.line_number() );
01951       return;
01952     }
01953     
01954       // If node-ordering is not the same as exodus...
01955     if (info->vtkConnOrder)
01956     {
01957       size = myMesh->element_connectivity( i, err ).size();     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01958       if (info->numNodes != size)
01959       {
01960         MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT,
01961           "Cell type %ld (%s) for element with %d nodes at Line %d",
01962           type, info->name, (int)size, tokens.line_number() ); 
01963         return;
01964       }
01965       
01966       tconn.resize( size );
01967       const std::vector<size_t>& conn = myMesh->element_connectivity( i, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01968       for (size_t j = 0; j < size; ++j)
01969       {
01970         tconn[j] = conn[info->vtkConnOrder[j]];
01971       }
01972         
01973       myMesh->reset_element( i, tconn, info->msqType, err );MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01974     }
01975       // Othewise (if node ordering is the same), just set the type.
01976     else
01977     {
01978       myMesh->element_topology( i, info->msqType, err );MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01979     }
01980   } // for(i)
01981 }
01982 
01983 void MeshImpl::vtk_create_structured_elems( const long* dims, 
01984                                             MsqError& err )
01985 {
01986     //NOTE: this should be work fine for edges also if 
01987     //      Mesquite ever supports them.  Just add the
01988     //      type for dimension 1 to the switch statement.
01989     
01990   //int non_zero[3] = {0,0,0};  // True if dim > 0 for x, y, z respectively
01991   long elem_dim = 0;          // Element dimension (2->quad, 3->hex)
01992   long num_elems = 1;         // Total number of elements
01993   long vert_per_elem;         // Element connectivity length
01994   long edims[3] = { 1, 1, 1 };// Number of elements in each grid direction
01995   
01996     // Populate above data
01997   for (int d = 0; d < 3; d++) 
01998     if (dims[d] > 1)
01999     {
02000       //non_zero[elem_dim] = d;
02001       edims[d] = dims[d] - 1;
02002       num_elems *= edims[d];
02003       elem_dim++;
02004     }
02005   vert_per_elem = 1 << elem_dim;
02006   
02007     // Get element type from element dimension
02008   EntityTopology type;
02009   switch( elem_dim )
02010   {
02011   //case 1: type = EDGE;          break;
02012     case 2: type = QUADRILATERAL; break;
02013     case 3: type = HEXAHEDRON;    break;
02014     default:
02015       MSQ_SETERR(err)( "Cannot create structured mesh with elements "
02016                        "of dimension < 2 or > 3.",
02017                        MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED );
02018       return;
02019   }
02020 
02021     // Allocate storage for elements
02022   myMesh->allocate_elements( num_elems, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02023   
02024     // Offsets of element vertices in grid relative to corner closest to origin 
02025   long k = dims[0]*dims[1];
02026   const long corners[8] = { 0, 1, 1+dims[0], dims[0], k, k+1, k+1+dims[0], k+dims[0] };
02027                              
02028     // Populate element list
02029   std::vector<size_t> conn( vert_per_elem );
02030   size_t elem_idx = 0;
02031   for (long z = 0; z < edims[2]; ++z)
02032     for (long y = 0; y < edims[1]; ++y)
02033       for (long x = 0; x < edims[0]; ++x)
02034       {
02035         const long index = x + y*dims[0] + z*(dims[0]*dims[1]);
02036         for (long j = 0; j < vert_per_elem; ++j)
02037           conn[j] = index + corners[j];
02038         myMesh->reset_element( elem_idx++, conn, type, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02039       }
02040 }
02041 
02042 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_field_data( FileTokenizer& tokens, 
02043                                      size_t count, 
02044                                      size_t num_fields,
02045                                      const std::string& field_name,
02046                                      TagDescription& tag, 
02047                                      MsqError& err )
02048 {
02049   tag.member = tokens.get_string(err);                  MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02050     // If field is a struct containing multiple members, make
02051     // tag name the concatentation of the field name and member
02052     // name.
02053   if (num_fields > 1)
02054   {
02055     tag.name = field_name;
02056     tag.name += " ";
02057     tag.name += tag.member;
02058     tag.member.clear();
02059   }
02060     // If field contains only one member, then make the tag
02061     // name be the field name, and store the member name to 
02062     // preserve it for subsequent writes.
02063   else
02064   {
02065     tag.name = field_name;
02066   }
02067 
02068     // Get tuple size and count from the file.
02069   long sizes[2];
02070   tokens.get_long_ints( 2, sizes, err );                MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02071   if (sizes[0] < 1) {
02072     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02073                      "Invalid tuple size (%ld) for field data %s at line %d\n",
02074                      sizes[0], tag.name.c_str(),
02075                      tokens.line_number() );
02076     return 0;
02077   }
02078   if (sizes[1] < 0 || (count && (size_t)sizes[1] != count)) {
02079     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02080                      "Invalid field data length at line %d.  "
02081                      "Cannot map %lu tuples to  %ld entities.\n", 
02082                      tokens.line_number(),
02083                      (unsigned long)count, sizes[1] );
02084     return 0;
02085   }
02086   
02087   int type = tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02088   void* result = vtk_read_typed_data( tokens, type, sizes[0], sizes[1], tag, err );
02089   MSQ_CHKERR(err);
02090   return result;
02091 }
02092 
02093 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_field( FileTokenizer& tokens, MsqError& err )
02094 {
02095     // This is not supported yet.
02096     // Parse the data but throw it away because
02097     // Mesquite has no internal representation for it.
02098   
02099   std::string name = tokens.get_string(err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02100   int count;
02101   tokens.get_integers( 1, &count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02102   
02103   for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
02104   {
02105     TagDescription tag;
02106     void* ptr = vtk_read_field_data( tokens, 0, 1, "", tag, err );
02107     if (ptr)
02108       free( ptr );
02109     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02110   }
02111 }
02112 
02113 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_attrib_data( FileTokenizer& tokens, 
02114                                       long count,
02115                                       TagDescription& tag,
02116                                       MsqError& err )
02117 {
02118   const char* const type_names[] = { "SCALARS",
02119                                      "COLOR_SCALARS",
02120                                      "VECTORS",
02121                                      "NORMALS",
02122                                      "TEXTURE_COORDINATES",
02123                                      "TENSORS",
02124                                      "FIELD",
02125   // Some buggy VTK files have empty CELL_DATA/POINT_DATA blocks
02126   // Try to allow them by checking for possible other tokens
02127   // indicating the end of the block
02128                                      "POINT_DATA",
02129                                      "CELL_DATA",
02130                                      "DATASET",
02131                                      0 };
02132 
02133   int type = tokens.match_token( type_names, err );  MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02134   if (type > 7) // empty CELL_DATA/POINT_DATA block.
02135   {
02136     tag.vtkType = TagDescription::NONE;
02137     tokens.unget_token();  
02138     return 0;
02139   }
02140   
02141   const char* name = tokens.get_string( err );       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02142   tag.name = name;
02143   
02144   void* data = 0;
02145   switch( type )
02146   {
02147     case 1: data = vtk_read_scalar_attrib ( tokens, count, tag, err ); 
02148             tag.vtkType = TagDescription::SCALAR; 
02149             break;
02150     case 2: data = vtk_read_color_attrib  ( tokens, count, tag, err ); 
02151             tag.vtkType = TagDescription::COLOR;
02152             break;
02153     case 3: data = vtk_read_vector_attrib ( tokens, count, tag, err );
02154             tag.vtkType = TagDescription::VECTOR;
02155             break;
02156     case 4: data = vtk_read_vector_attrib ( tokens, count, tag, err ); 
02157             tag.vtkType = TagDescription::NORMAL;
02158             break;
02159     case 5: data = vtk_read_texture_attrib( tokens, count, tag, err ); 
02160             tag.vtkType = TagDescription::TEXTURE;
02161             break;
02162     case 6: data = vtk_read_tensor_attrib ( tokens, count, tag, err ); 
02163             tag.vtkType = TagDescription::TENSOR;
02164             break;
02165     case 7: data = 0;
02166             tag.vtkType = TagDescription::FIELD;
02167             break;
02168   }
02169 
02170   return data;
02171 }
02172 
02173 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_point_data( FileTokenizer& tokens, 
02174                                     MsqError& err )
02175 {
02176   TagDescription tag;
02177   void* data = vtk_read_attrib_data( tokens, myMesh->num_vertices(), tag, err );
02178   if (data) // normal attribute
02179   {
02180     vtk_store_point_data( data, tag, err );
02181     free(data);
02182     MSQ_CHKERR(err);
02183     return;;
02184   }
02185   else if (tag.vtkType == TagDescription::FIELD)
02186   {
02187     std::string field = tag.name;
02188     int field_count;
02189     tokens.get_integers( 1, &field_count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02190     for (int i = 0; i < field_count; ++i)
02191     {
02192       data = vtk_read_field_data( tokens, myMesh->num_vertices(), field_count, field, tag, err );
02193       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02194       vtk_store_point_data( data, tag, err );
02195       free( data );
02196       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02197     }
02198   }
02199 }
02200   
02201 void MeshImpl::vtk_store_point_data( const void* data, TagDescription& tag, MsqError& err )
02202 {  
02203   size_t tag_handle = myTags->handle( tag.name, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02204   if (!tag_handle)
02205   {
02206     tag_handle = myTags->create( tag, 0, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02207   }
02208   else 
02209   {
02210     const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties( tag_handle, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02211     if (desc != tag)
02212     {
02213       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02214                        "Inconsistent types between element "
02215                        "and vertex attributes named \"%s\"\n",
02216                        tag.name.c_str() );
02217       return;
02218     }
02219   }
02220   
02221   std::vector<size_t> vertex_handles;
02222   myMesh->all_vertices( vertex_handles, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02223   if (!vertex_handles.empty()) 
02224     myTags->set_vertex_data( tag_handle, 
02225                              vertex_handles.size(),
02226                              arrptr(vertex_handles),
02227                              data,
02228                              err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02229 }
02230 
02231 
02232 void MeshImpl::vtk_read_cell_data( FileTokenizer& tokens, 
02233                                    MsqError& err )
02234 {
02235   TagDescription tag;
02236   void* data = vtk_read_attrib_data( tokens, myMesh->num_elements(), tag, err );
02237   if (data) // normal attribute
02238   {
02239     vtk_store_cell_data( data, tag, err );
02240     free(data);
02241     MSQ_CHKERR(err);
02242     return;;
02243   }
02244   else if (tag.vtkType == TagDescription::FIELD)
02245   {
02246     std::string field = tag.name;
02247     int field_count;
02248     tokens.get_integers( 1, &field_count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02249     for (int i = 0; i < field_count; ++i)
02250     {
02251       data = vtk_read_field_data( tokens, myMesh->num_elements(), field_count, field, tag, err );
02252       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02253       vtk_store_cell_data( data, tag, err );
02254       free( data );
02255       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02256     }
02257   }
02258 }
02259 
02260 void MeshImpl::vtk_store_cell_data( const void* data, TagDescription& tag, MsqError& err )
02261 {  
02262   size_t tag_handle = myTags->handle( tag.name, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02263   if (!tag_handle)
02264   {
02265     tag_handle = myTags->create( tag, 0, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02266   }
02267   else 
02268   {
02269     const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties( tag_handle, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02270     if (desc != tag)
02271     {
02272       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02273                        "Inconsistent types between element "
02274                        "and vertex attributes named \"%s\"\n",
02275                        tag.name.c_str() );
02276       return;
02277     }
02278   }
02279   
02280   std::vector<size_t> element_handles;
02281   myMesh->all_elements( element_handles, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02282   if (!element_handles.empty()) 
02283     myTags->set_element_data( tag_handle, 
02284                               element_handles.size(),
02285                               arrptr(element_handles),
02286                               data,
02287                               err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02288 }
02289 
02290 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_typed_data( FileTokenizer& tokens, 
02291                                      int type, 
02292                                      size_t per_elem, 
02293                                      size_t num_elem,
02294                                      TagDescription& tag,
02295                                      MsqError &err )
02296 {
02297   void* data_ptr;
02298   size_t count = per_elem * num_elem;
02299   switch ( type )
02300   {
02301     case 1:
02302       tag.size = per_elem*sizeof(bool);
02303       tag.type = BOOL;
02304       data_ptr = malloc( num_elem*tag.size );
02305       tokens.get_booleans( count, (bool*)data_ptr, err );
02306       break;
02307     case 2:
02308     case 3:
02309     case 4:
02310     case 5:
02311     case 6:
02312     case 7:
02313       tag.size = per_elem*sizeof(int);
02314       tag.type = INT;
02315       data_ptr = malloc( num_elem*tag.size );
02316       tokens.get_integers( count, (int*)data_ptr, err );
02317       break;
02318     case 8:
02319     case 9:
02320       // this is a bit of a hack since MeshImpl doesn't have a LONG type (HANDLE is used by ParallelMesh for long)
02321       tag.size = per_elem*sizeof(size_t);
02322       assert(sizeof(long) == sizeof(size_t));
02323       assert(sizeof(long) == sizeof(void *));
02324       tag.type = HANDLE;
02325       data_ptr = malloc( num_elem*tag.size );
02326       tokens.get_long_ints( count, (long*)data_ptr, err );
02327       break;
02328     case 10:
02329     case 11:
02330       tag.size = per_elem*sizeof(double);
02331       tag.type = DOUBLE;
02332       data_ptr = malloc( num_elem*tag.size );
02333       tokens.get_doubles( count, (double*)data_ptr, err );
02334       break;
02335     default:
02336       MSQ_SETERR(err)( "Invalid data type", MsqError::INVALID_ARG );
02337       return 0;
02338   }
02339   
02340   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
02341   {
02342     free( data_ptr );
02343     return 0;
02344   }
02345   
02346   return data_ptr;
02347 }
02348   
02349       
02350       
02351 
02352 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_scalar_attrib( FileTokenizer& tokens,
02353                                         long count,
02354                                         TagDescription& desc,
02355                                         MsqError& err )
02356 {
02357   if (!count)
02358     return 0;
02359 
02360   int type = tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );      MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02361     
02362   long size;
02363   const char* tok = tokens.get_string( err );                MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02364   const char* end = 0;
02365   size = strtol( tok, (char**)&end, 0 );
02366   if (*end)
02367   {
02368     size = 1;
02369     tokens.unget_token();
02370   }
02371   
02372     // VTK spec says cannot be greater than 4--do we care?
02373   if (size < 1 || size > 4)
02374   {
02375     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02376                     "Scalar count out of range [1,4]" 
02377                     " at line %d", tokens.line_number());
02378     return 0;
02379   }
02380   
02381   tokens.match_token("LOOKUP_TABLE",err);                     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02382   tok = tokens.get_string(err);                               MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02383   
02384     // If no lookup table, just read and return the data
02385   if (!strcmp( tok, "default" ))
02386   {
02387     void* ptr = vtk_read_typed_data( tokens, type, size, count, desc, err );
02388     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02389     return ptr;
02390   }
02391   
02392     // If we got this far, then the data has a lookup
02393     // table.  First read the lookup table and convert
02394     // to integers.
02395   string name = tok;
02396   vector<long> table( size*count );
02397   if (type > 0 && type < 10)  // Is an integer type
02398   {
02399     tokens.get_long_ints( table.size(), arrptr(table), err );   
02400     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02401   }
02402   else // Is a real-number type
02403   {
02404     for (std::vector<long>::iterator iter = table.begin(); iter != table.end(); ++iter)
02405     {
02406       double data;
02407       tokens.get_doubles( 1, &data, err );
02408       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02409 
02410       *iter = (long)data;
02411       if ((double)*iter != data)
02412       {
02413         MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02414                          "Invalid lookup index (%.0f) at line %d",
02415                          data, tokens.line_number() );
02416         return 0;
02417       }
02418     }
02419   }
02420   
02421     // Now read the data - must be float RGBA color triples
02422   
02423   long table_count;
02424   tokens.match_token( "LOOKUP_TABLE", err );                  MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02425   tokens.match_token( name.c_str(), err );                    MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02426   tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &table_count, err );               MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02427  
02428   vector<float> table_data(table_count*4);
02429   tokens.get_floats( table_data.size(), arrptr(table_data), err );MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02430   
02431     // Create list from indexed data
02432   
02433   float* data = (float*)malloc( sizeof(float)*count*size*4 );
02434   float* data_iter = data;
02435   for (std::vector<long>::iterator idx = table.begin(); idx != table.end(); ++idx)
02436   {
02437     if (*idx < 0 || *idx >= table_count)
02438     {
02439       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02440                        "LOOKUP_TABLE index %ld out of range.",
02441                        *idx );
02442       free( data );
02443       return  0;
02444     }
02445     
02446     for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02447     {
02448       *data_iter = table_data[4 * *idx + i];
02449       ++data_iter;
02450     }
02451   }
02452   
02453   desc.size = size * 4 * sizeof(float);
02454   desc.type = DOUBLE;
02455   return data;
02456 }
02457 
02458 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_color_attrib( FileTokenizer& tokens, 
02459                                        long count, 
02460                                        TagDescription& tag,
02461                                        MsqError& err )
02462 {
02463   long size;
02464   tokens.get_long_ints( 1, &size, err );                    MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02465   
02466   if (size < 1)
02467   {
02468     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR, 
02469                      "Invalid size (%ld) at line %d",
02470                      size, tokens.line_number() );
02471     return 0;
02472   }
02473   
02474   float* data = (float*)malloc( sizeof(float)*count*size );
02475   tokens.get_floats( count*size, data, err );
02476   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
02477   {
02478     free( data );
02479     return 0;
02480   }
02481   
02482   tag.size = size*sizeof(float);
02483   tag.type = DOUBLE;
02484   return data;
02485 }
02486 
02487 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_vector_attrib( FileTokenizer& tokens, 
02488                                         long count, 
02489                                         TagDescription& tag,
02490                                         MsqError& err )
02491 {
02492   int type = tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );
02493   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02494     
02495   void* result = vtk_read_typed_data( tokens, type, 3, count, tag, err );
02496   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02497   return result;
02498 }
02499 
02500 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_texture_attrib( FileTokenizer& tokens,
02501                                          long count,
02502                                          TagDescription& tag,
02503                                          MsqError& err )
02504 {
02505   int type, dim;
02506   tokens.get_integers( 1, &dim, err );
02507   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02508   type = tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );
02509   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02510     
02511   if (dim < 1 || dim > 3)
02512   {
02513     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
02514                      "Invalid dimension (%d) at line %d.",
02515                      dim, tokens.line_number() );
02516     return 0;
02517   }
02518   
02519   void* result = vtk_read_typed_data( tokens, type, dim, count, tag, err );
02520   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02521   return result;
02522 }
02523 
02524 void* MeshImpl::vtk_read_tensor_attrib( FileTokenizer& tokens,
02525                                         long count, 
02526                                         TagDescription& tag,
02527                                         MsqError& err )
02528 {
02529   int type = tokens.match_token( vtk_type_names, err );
02530   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02531     
02532   void* result = vtk_read_typed_data( tokens, type, 9, count, tag, err );
02533   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02534   return result;
02535 }  
02536 
02537 
02538 void MeshImpl::vtk_write_attrib_data( std::ostream& file,
02539                                       const TagDescription& desc,
02540                                       const void* data, size_t count,
02541                                       MsqError& err ) const
02542 {
02543   //srkenno@sandia.gov: we now allow this type to be able to write e.g. GLOBAL_ID for parallel meshes
02544   /*
02545   if (desc.type == HANDLE)
02546   {
02547     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Cannot write HANDLE tag data to VTK file.",
02548                     MsqError::FILE_FORMAT);
02549     return;
02550     }*/
02551   
02552   TagDescription::VtkType vtk_type = desc.vtkType;
02553   unsigned vlen = desc.size / MeshImplTags::size_from_tag_type(desc.type);
02554     // guess one from data length if not set
02555   if (vtk_type == TagDescription::NONE)
02556   {
02557     switch ( vlen )
02558     {
02559       default: vtk_type = TagDescription::SCALAR; break;
02560       case 3: vtk_type = TagDescription::VECTOR; break;
02561       case 9: vtk_type = TagDescription::TENSOR; break;
02562         return;
02563     }
02564   }
02565 
02566   //srkenno@sandia.gov: from class Mesh, the typenames below should correspond in order...
02567   // enum TagType { BYTE, BOOL, INT, DOUBLE, HANDLE };
02568 
02569   const char* const typenames[] = { "unsigned_char", "bit", "int", "double", "unsigned_long" };
02570   std::string field, member;
02571   
02572   int num_per_line;
02573   switch (vtk_type)
02574   {
02575     case TagDescription::SCALAR: 
02576       num_per_line = vlen; 
02577       file << "SCALARS " << desc.name << " " << typenames[desc.type] << " " << vlen << "\n";
02578       file << "LOOKUP_TABLE default\n";
02579       break;
02580     case TagDescription::COLOR : 
02581       num_per_line = vlen;
02582       file << "COLOR_SCALARS " << desc.name << " " << vlen << "\n";
02583       break;
02584     case TagDescription::VECTOR:
02585       num_per_line = 3;
02586       if (vlen != 3)
02587       {
02588         MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR,
02589          "Tag \"%s\" is labeled as a VTK vector attribute but has %u values.",
02590          desc.name.c_str(), vlen);
02591         return;
02592       }
02593       file << "VECTORS " << desc.name << " " << typenames[desc.type] << "\n";
02594       break;
02595     case TagDescription::NORMAL:
02596       num_per_line = 3;
02597       if (vlen != 3)
02598       {
02599         MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR,
02600          "Tag \"%s\" is labeled as a VTK normal attribute but has %u values.",
02601          desc.name.c_str(), vlen);
02602         return;
02603       }
02604       file << "NORMALS " << desc.name << " " << typenames[desc.type] << "\n";
02605       break;
02606     case TagDescription::TEXTURE:
02607       num_per_line = vlen;
02608       file << "TEXTURE_COORDINATES " << desc.name << " " << typenames[desc.type] << " " << vlen << "\n";
02609       break;
02610     case TagDescription::TENSOR:
02611       num_per_line = 3;
02612       if (vlen != 9)
02613       {
02614         MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR,
02615          "Tag \"%s\" is labeled as a VTK tensor attribute but has %u values.",
02616          desc.name.c_str(), vlen);
02617         return;
02618       }
02619       file << "TENSORS " << desc.name << " " << typenames[desc.type] << "\n";
02620       break;
02621     case TagDescription::FIELD:
02622       num_per_line = vlen;
02623       get_field_names( desc, field, member, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02624       file << member << " " << vlen << " " << count << " " << typenames[desc.type] << "\n";
02625       break;
02626     default:
02627       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unknown VTK attribute type for tag.", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR );
02628       return;
02629   }
02630   
02631   size_t i, total = count*vlen;
02632   char* space = new char[num_per_line];
02633   memset( space, ' ', num_per_line );
02634   space[num_per_line-1] = '\n';
02635   const unsigned char* odata = (const unsigned char*)data;
02636   const bool* bdata = (const bool*)data;
02637   const int* idata = (const int*)data;
02638   const  long* ldata = (const long*)data;
02639   const double* ddata = (const double*)data;
02640   switch ( desc.type )
02641   {
02642     case BYTE:
02643       for (i = 0 ; i < total; ++i)
02644         file << (unsigned int)odata[i] << space[i%num_per_line];
02645       break;
02646     case BOOL:
02647       for (i = 0 ; i < total; ++i)
02648         file << (bdata[i] ? '1' : '0') << space[i%num_per_line];
02649       break;
02650     case INT:
02651       for (i = 0 ; i < total; ++i)
02652         file << idata[i] << space[i%num_per_line];
02653       break;
02654     case DOUBLE:
02655       for (i = 0 ; i < total; ++i)
02656         file << ddata[i] << space[i%num_per_line];
02657       break;
02658     case HANDLE:
02659       for (i = 0 ; i < total; ++i)
02660         file << ldata[i] << space[i%num_per_line];
02661       break;
02662     default:
02663       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unknown tag type.", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
02664   }
02665   delete [] space;
02666 }
02667       
02668         
02669           
02670   
02671 
02672 
02673 /**************************************************************************
02674  *                               TAGS
02675  **************************************************************************/
02676 
02677 
02678 TagHandle MeshImpl::tag_create( const std::string& name,
02679                                 TagType type,
02680                                 unsigned length,
02681                                 const void* defval,
02682                                 MsqError& err )
02683 {
02684   TagDescription::VtkType vtype;
02685   std::string field;
02686   switch( length ) 
02687   {
02688     case 1:  vtype = TagDescription::SCALAR; break;
02689     case 3:  vtype = TagDescription::VECTOR; break;
02690     case 9:  vtype = TagDescription::TENSOR; break;
02691     default: vtype = TagDescription::FIELD;
02692              field = MESQUITE_FIELD_TAG;     break;
02693   }
02694   
02695     // If tag name contains a space, assume the tag name
02696     // is a concatenation of the VTK field and member names.
02697   if (vtype != TagDescription::FIELD &&
02698       name.find(" ") != std::string::npos)
02699     vtype = TagDescription::FIELD;
02700   
02701   size_t size = MeshImplTags::size_from_tag_type( type );
02702   TagDescription desc( name, type, vtype, length*size, field );
02703   size_t index = myTags->create( desc, defval, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02704   return (TagHandle)index;
02705 }
02706 
02707 void MeshImpl::tag_delete( TagHandle handle, MsqError& err )
02708 {
02709   myTags->destroy( (size_t)handle, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
02710 }
02711 
02712 TagHandle MeshImpl::tag_get( const std::string& name, MsqError& err )
02713 {
02714   size_t index = myTags->handle( name, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
02715   if (!index) 
02716     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::TAG_NOT_FOUND, "could not find tag \"%s\"", name.c_str() );
02717   return (TagHandle)index;
02718 }
02719 
02720 void MeshImpl::tag_properties( TagHandle handle,
02721                                std::string& name,
02722                                TagType& type,
02723                                unsigned& length,
02724                                MsqError& err )
02725 {
02726   const TagDescription& desc 
02727     = myTags->properties( (size_t)handle, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
02728   
02729   name = desc.name;
02730   type = desc.type;
02731   length = (unsigned)(desc.size / MeshImplTags::size_from_tag_type( desc.type ));
02732 }
